~Melissa

----- Original Message -----
From: Faith Void
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, May 29, 2008 7:52 AM
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] speaking of conferences


After atteding NEU, I have been thinking that I would like to plan a
conference for my area. It was really wonderful to experience other
unschooling families and see everyone where they were on their
journey. And the best part was all the wonderful, amazing kids! I
especially realized the comfort of the conference on Monday in the
park while searching for everyone. I overheard a mother threatening
her kid, even though it was done jokingly I could feel the sting. I
realized then how comforting it was to hear all that loving, gentle
parenting going on all weekend. It is so much easier to be a gentle
parent surrounded by other unschoolers. It was also great to see that
other peoples families were not "perfect stepford families" and that
when my kids fought, etc I wasn't a failure. I feel a renewed
confidence in myself.

Does anyone who has coordinated one feel like offering me direction? Thanks
Faith

--
www.bearthmama.com

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] speaking of conferences
messages.msgSnippet: Faith It s not a good time right *now*---I m traveling and visiting with the Gauchmans now and will be heading homeward tomorrow---but I would be happy to give
messages.messageBody:
Faith

It's not a good time right *now*---I'm traveling and visiting with the
Gauchmans now and will be heading homeward tomorrow---but I would be
happy to give you pointers and suggestions and tell you what to avoid
and what some of the pitfalls are.

Call me later next week---we can talk at length. 803 237 4948 cell or
803 776 4849 home.

I'm glad you had such a good time. Conferences really DO make a
difference and are POWERFUL, aren't they? <g>


~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://www.LiveandLearnConference.org
